text:
Hi all,
Before we update the account we wonder if this is possible:
Can product creates/updates on HubSpot be used to trigger actions in automation workflows?

Hello everyone,
Is there any possibility to send customized data (as an array or object of elements) using an API to use it in an email that will be sent from a workflow?

Hi guys, anyone else having an issue of not being able to view values for a property as part of a trigger? I'm trying to trigger based on a deal being in a specific deal stage, and have done this before successfully. But any new workflows I make, nothing shows up in the deal stage value dropdown (perma searching) and even old ones I try to edit, show a weird number, and if I remove it, I can't get it again:
Nothing shows in the search....
In the future will we be able to set the percentages of the branches, It's kind of annoying to create 10 branches just so you have 1 branch with a 10% hit rate.
That's a good one
You can go to action the other 8, but you're right, that's probably more complex than intended
it's something we've discussed <@U01QVR44MEY> -- whats an example scenario where you'd want to do 10/90 split?
I've got one - what if I want to test YEET-ing a marketing email to a 10% test segment?
I would agree with that, also another one is a more complex take on AB testing programmatic emails
Maybe it's a substantial change from standard
And a 50/50 A/B isn't suitable
But I don't want to go through an ABCDEFGHIJ test
:joy::sweat_smile:

so say you send out this long shot email to 10% ---- do you send something less experimental to the other 90%, or are you waiting and decided what you are going to send the 90% based on how the 10% engagement goes?
I suppose you could do either
But for sake of argument, let's pretend both are simultaneous
The 90 branch could just have a delay block anyways
If you wanted to be really cool you could then set a filter criteria for the other 90 based on metrics of some specific event
E.g. if the 10% send email gets >XYZ open rate then send A else, B
But that's pretty extra

tell us more, we had spoken about that use case as a third version of this component, where we use a “live data algorithm” to determine which branch to send customers down, rather than a fixed percentage
Ooooh :eyes:
Tell us more about the "Live data algorithm" <@UHVJJUWFN>, you can't say something like that and not tell us more
Also <@UHVJJUWFN> I need a way to get workflow context - live algorithm implies you have a way to get that
Workflows API (from legacy docs) seems to only work for contact workflows
And may or may not (?) work
this is very much an exploratory type of feature which we 100% don’t support yet
This seems like a bug, could you file a support ticket so we can investigate?
I don't mind if you 2% support it
and the only way we get to work on it is by having customers ask us for specific use cases they want solved
so this is where you come in
Tell me what you think it *might* be able to do
And the limitations and scope
And I can give you infinite use cases
Picture this like a sketch, not a promise of capabilities

haha alright, well our thought was to one day create the “converging” algorithm, where the branching would start 50/50 but based on certain criteria (success metrics of some sort), the branch with the more successful events would increase in percentage flow
<@U01QVR44MEY> let's brainstorm
<@UHVJJUWFN> how is it getting the info for the workflow success or metrics and how much data do we think it can currently or potentially get?
we don’t know that yet, that would be part of our solution
Ok that sounds like expansion of workflow API maybe?
One easy use case is automated A/B testing
You define end goal (click, CTR, open, etc) and the percentage increases towards the higher percentage performing email over time until it gets to 100% and 0%
Second could be weighted distribution for round robin
As meetings booked via meeting link increase relative to other users in the workflow, the percentage split decreases (down to 0)
You could also have maybe an attendees based criteria if you have a workshop
As attendees approach max capacity, lower percentage of userbase sent invite for workshop
You could maybe even do cool delay workflows with this
a lot of what I’m referring to will be internals to our tool, which is why we’re lookign for specific use cases to solve for, not generic solutions to expose via our APIs

10% send email A
Delay 1 week
Based on open rate of email A send either previous base email B or email A to that other 90%
there’s no way to throttle execution right now so that particular use case wouldn’t work
<@U04T2CUCP8T> would you call what you are talking about "hold out testing"

because its not that you are having two emails compete, its that you are testing email A and if it performs well you will use it for the 90% of customers you have "held out" and if it does not perform well you have a back up email
That's a good way to put it <@U01DSSS4Z6D>
Where can I do this? Can't seem to find how to do this

We are trying to create a workflow that makes use of two (2) objects:

• Contacts
• Licenses (a custom object)
The purpose of this workflow is to send emails to contacts based on the Expiration Date of their associated License (License custom object).

Accessing properties from both objects for the trigger criteria does not seem to be an issue. The issues start to occur when we start setting up actions.

There are a couple of actions that are vital to the workflow:

• Delays
• Setting contacts as marketing contacts
If we set the workflow up as a Contact-based workflow we can set as marketing contact without issue. Of course, this makes sense because it’s Contact-based. We cannot, however, set a delay based on a date property (Expiration Date, specifically) in the license object. The only date properties that are available to us are those related to the contact.

Now, if we set the workflow up as a License-based workflow we can set the delay without issue, but we can not set the associated contact as a marketing contact.

Has anyone experienced anything similar? Ideally we’d like to keep a Contact-based workflow, but I realize that may not be possible.

Just wondering…

• Is there a way to set a contact as a marketing contact using a custom code module?
• Is there a way to create/mimic a delay using a custom code module?
Or maybe there is something else we’re missing. We have our object associations set up, so I don’t think there’s any issue there. Also, we don’t want to write to a custom contact property because a contact can have several/many licenses and that could get messy.

I appreciate any feedback and/or advice.

One approach to get the delay based on a license property is to "copy down" the license field to a contact in a separate workflow. 

I imagine HubSpot problem is that associations are 1-many so you can't reference a single one. By copying it down yourself, you get access without relying on the association.

Thanks for that. That was something I had thought of, but since a contact can have several licenses, and could theoretically be in several workflows at once, I was afraid it would get messy because I would need more than one contact property to potentially accommodate.

Are you saying to basically have only one custom contact property for this purpose, and then in the workflow, shoot them over to another workflow to change the property? I suppose that could work even if they have multiple licenses and are in multiple workflows.
You can only have a single license that "wins", I'm not sure of another solution
Unless you do the workflow on the license level and denormalize contact data onto it. Basically the reverse of what I suggested
There should be a little “Help” button in the bottom right of your screen. If you click here you should be able to contact customer support
